tweets.text:
"We do know that local volunteers are pulling sanitary waste out of the river just upstream of 'Hackney Beach'." The reality of England's rivers.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/rdKF8KpJFu
@StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids Someone will be in touch shortly

Hi @RachSalv, can you help us? We're a community plagued by noxious gasses coming from a poorly run landfill that is far to close to houses. Easily the most complained about site in the UK and the @EnvAgencyMids failed us for years. Can you help?

Always appetising to enjoy a seasonal G&T on bank holiday weekend accompanied by wafts of crap, eggs and rubbish which @ClareDinnisEA & her @EnvAgency seem incapable of addressing. Cheers everyone, coming to a town near you soon if not stopped! @BorisJohnson @StinkStopthe https://t.co/tQ1P9hUb6a

tweets.text: We were informed by @EnvAgencySE that the sorbents and remaining oil would be removed from the stream, but it has not been done yet(Friday 09/04/2021) We would like to know when the oil will be removed.@EnvAgencySE @thameswater #SilkStream #WelshHarp #cleantheharp https://t.co/tMZxF6uBKx https://t.co/0vEBguCygZ

The EA called back, they finally think they know which business has been doing this every few months for the last few years, still no oil boom and unlikely they'll prosecute.. üòï https://t.co/TdCZPFKpNN

#FF @MarkJarnell @CFOESFRS @theripplepond @RespectYourself @AidTrain @CFOESFRS @SimpleIsntIt @999Day @DontLetYourTea @dkennars65 @rogernield2703 @cate_a_moore @RoamingRoyston @bigphilcampion @joolstom @FireSafetyAcad @HantsIOW_fire @Firesnapper999 @masato_jones @EnvAgency https://t.co/u8rjQXCgpK
The #RiverVer is one of only 200 or so #chalkstreams in the world and enjoying a rare good year. And somebody thinks it's OK to turn it yellow! @EnvAgencySE informed. https://t.co/JW3CbL4mK0

Good work from #flyfishing members, last of planting along our Hubberholme beat #Wharfe. Fencing was funded by @EnvAgencyYNE #Fishery Improvement Prog & @SandTCUKYorks in #partnership @WildTroutTrust @YorkDalesRT
Seemed rude not to fish after https://t.co/sSUPZQYjYd

tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 I can save everyone reading this. You've done nothing, you are doing nothing and you plan to do nothing in the future.

Soil erosion, what causes it and why is it such a problem?  Dr Richard Smith has been working on soil erosion in the EA for 25 years, and in this video he illustrates the challenging soil and weather conditions in the South West @SoilsAlliance https://t.co/Y2m7bLy6xF

Latest from #Lewes - plant machinery is being used to help us tackle the fire involving 250 tonnes of scrap metal. We're making good progress.  Great work by our partners, @ESFRS_Control and crews on the ground. @EnvAgencySE @sussex_police @SECAmbulance https://t.co/tpX8na7LaH

The sorbents which have been put in the #SilkStream to remove the oil spills from the stream at the Trash Screen/trap where the Silkstream enters the Welsh Harp are still there. When will the sorbents and the remaining oil be removed? @EnvAgencySE @thameswater @BarnetCouncil https://t.co/8NQLosWLQi https://t.co/hDF9UZLKZR

@BradfordCityAA @Jack_Hirst3 @EnvAgencyYNE @SandTCUKYorks @WildTroutTrust @YorkDalesRT @baileyffmuk @ProfJGrey @PeteTurnerEA @MickC1954 Nice to see some positive stuff from an angling clubüëç 

Thankfully very different from when the club destroyed an old hedgerow at Shipton Pond in the late 80‚Äôs for no good reason.

@amorexplore @hackneycouncil @TheBrokedownPal @EnvAgency Thank you. Yes, we know too little about what ends up in the Lea. More rain will mean pollution washed off the roads into the rivers (from 80 square miles of paved surfaces). 
With no live sewer spill alerts from Thames Water we're left to guess if they'll start discharging.

tweets.text:
#InvasiveSpecies

Asian Clam Corbicula fluminea has now colonised several reaches of the River Trent in Staffordshire, especially downstream of where the river and the Trent & Mersey Canal exchange water. https://t.co/jBU55ou2tA

Dr Paola Sakai blogs about the impact of the findings of the exciting project 'Bridging the knowledge gap to boost #SME resilience‚Äô.

All will be revealed at a virtual event on Wednesday 21 April 9.30am ‚Äì 11.30am.
https://t.co/GlOW3N97qN

Book your place  https://t.co/PGN8Ix0xd5 https://t.co/zv9DQ0acmF

@RossCherrington @bettwsresident @EnvAgencySW @SoilsAlliance This is what is normally done with the growers I work with.

Harvesting swedes on the left, and chisel ploughed on the right, even in less than ideal conditions. It can work, but not if it rains every day. Of course this is a temporary fix, that needs sorting when it dries out. https://t.co/dpjYBNBhaM

@bettwsresident @RossCherrington @EnvAgencySW @SoilsAlliance Yes it is important.
But risky fields such as this one with winter veg can be manageable. This slope was deep chisel ploughed after harvest, and left rough.  It would have been similar to the bottom headland if not managed.  Surprising how stable that bare clay loam soil can be! https://t.co/zWeacuDInd

@RossCherrington @bettwsresident @EnvAgencySW @SoilsAlliance Agreed it rains a lot anyway.  Named storms in the context of this video that‚Äôs all. üëç.  Just interested to know where the line is drawn in the sand with force majeureüòè.

@StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA Staggering... out of control, the crisis is becoming a disaster #StopTheStink How long can the complaints be ignored?

About time you listened @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @DefraGovUK @MPGeorgeEustice @BorisJohnson @MattHancock This has to stop - when will you do your duty & protect the children of this town for good? @StinkStopthe https://t.co/Humf4WrJ0i

entity.name: Good Morning Britain
entity.description: Good morning, Britain. Up early and need to catch up on the latest news, weather and sports? Then this weekday morning programme is for you, offering the latest information in such areas as entertainment, health and money. `Good Morning Britain' is the typical morning news and talk show. It features a number of presenters, correspondents and reporters covering what you should know to start your day before heading out the door.
